name: Kepler-273
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-273 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-273 is a star with 0.7050000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.81 times its radius. It is located 2377.19 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-273 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-273 b

Kepler-273 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.94 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-273.

The mass of Kepler-273 b is 2.55 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-273 b is 1.5 that of Earth. At 2.55 Earth masses, Kepler-273 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-273 c

Kepler-273 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.01 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-273.

The mass of Kepler-273 c is 4.98 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-273 c is 1.98 that of Earth. At 4.98 Earth masses, Kepler-273 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-273, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
